item.title: Fedora Home Server
item.author: Author
item.description: How to How to install, start and connect to SSH Server on Fedora Linux > sudo systemctl status sshd # if inactive... > sudo systemctl enable sshd > sudo systemctl start sshd # now should be active # try to connect from other machine.. > ssh [remote_user_name]@x.x.x.x How to install docker-compose > sudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/1.26.0/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose > sudo mv /usr/local/bin/docker-compose /usr/bin/docker-compose > sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/docker-compose Start PiHole > docker-compose up -d Issues Cannot connect to docker daemon # check status > sudo service docker status # if not running then.

item.title: Rabbitmq Cheatsheet
item.author: Rob
item.description: Prerequiesites Install Docker Desktop Run Docker image docker run -it --rm --name rabbitmq -p 5672:5672 -p 15672:15672 rabbitmq:3.10-management Management panel: http://localhost:15672/#/

item.title: Kubernetes Cheatsheet
item.author: Rob
item.description: Most common commands kubectl --help kubectl version kubectl cluster-info kubectl get all kubectl run [pod-name] --image [image-name] # delete current pod (might bring back a new replica if it has deployment resource created) kubectl delete [pod-name] # deletes deployment resource that run pod kubectl delete deployment [name-of-deployment] kubectl port-forward [pod-name] [external-port]::[internal-port] kubectl expose ... # expose a port kubectl create [resource] # create resource kubectl apply [resource] # create/modify resource Aliasing kubectl PowerShell Set-Alias -Name k -Value kubectl

item.title: Hugo Cheatsheet
item.author: Rob
item.description: HUGO Cheatsheet Project Homepage: https://gohugo.io/ Content > hugo new posts/my-first-post.md Drafts do not get deployed; once you finish a post, update the header of the post to say draft: false. Markdown Cheatsheet Commands # Hugo server > hugo server -D # Build static pages: > hugo -D Installation Follow instructions: https://gohugo.io/getting-started/installing Releases: https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/releases # verify installation > hugo version # Create new site > hugo new site [SITE_NAME]
